ud7.2:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud7.2:1.3: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring Venerable Bhaddiya the Dwarf with even more Dhamma talk, thinking that he was still a trainee.
ud7.2:2.1: The Buddha saw what was happening.
ud7.2:3.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud7.2:4.1: “They’ve cut the cycle, gone to the wishless;
ud7.2:4.2: the streams are dried, they flow no more.
ud7.2:4.3: Cut, the cycle no longer turns.
ud7.2:4.4: Just this is the end of suffering.”
